benchmark_details.name: Aligned Music Notation and Lyrics Transcription (AMNLT)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces and formalizes the Aligned Music Notation and Lyrics Transcription (AMNLT) challenge, which addresses the complete transcription of vocal scores by jointly considering music symbols, lyrics, and their synchronization.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a comprehensive framework for the transcription of vocal music scores that integrates the alignment between music notation and lyrics.

data.source: Four datasets: GregoSynth, Solesmes, Einsiedeln, and Salzinnes
data.size: 20,000 pages for GregoSynth, 854 systems for Solesmes, 1,816 excerpts for Einsiedeln, and 2,965 excerpts for Salzinnes
data.annotation: Annotations follow specific encoding formats and were conducted with expert supervision.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the edit distance for each transcription related to musical elements and lyrics.
methodology.interpretation: Lower scores in MER, CER, SylER, and AlER indicate better transcription and alignment quality.
methodology.validation: Performance evaluated through experiments on four distinct datasets.
